lead_paragraph: There are growing signs that investigators are focusing on bigger targets and looking more intently on the deaths of 12 people from Legionnaires’ disease.

headline.print_headline: State Braces as Inquiry Into Flint Crisis Widens
headline.main: Flint, and Michigan, Brace for More Charges in Water Inquiry

snippet: There are growing signs that investigators are focusing on bigger targets and looking more intently on the deaths of 12 people from Legionnaires’ disease....
abstract: Michigan Atty Gen Bill Schuette declines to talk about potential suspects or additional charges that may result from investigation into water contamination crisis in Flint, Mich; many in state's political hierarchy seem to be bracing for another round of arrests; nine low- or mid-level government officials have been charged in investigation, and Schuette has said outbreak of Legionnaires' disease related to crisis has been new focus for investigators.
